dublin_core.dcvalue: The use of hand held cellular mobile phones while driving has stirred more debate passion and research than perhaps any other traffic safety issue in the past several years There is ample research showing that the use of either hand held or hands free cellular phones can lead to unsafe driving patterns Whether or not these performance deficits increase the risk of crash is difficult to establish but recent studies are beginning to suggest that cellular phone use elevates crash risk
Driver hand-held cellular phone use: a four-year analysis.
